statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Boston U. 84, Hartford 71
article.story: WEST HARTFORD, Conn. (AP) -- Corey Hassan scored a career-high 23 points and Bryan Geffen scored a career high 18 to lead Boston University to an 84-71 victory over the University of Hartford Sunday in an America East basketball game. It was Bostons third consecutive victory and makes the Terriers (12-15 overall, 9-7 America East) the third seed in the America East championship tournament, which starts Friday in Binghamton, N.Y. Hartford finishes the regular season 13-14, 9-7 and will be the fourth seed in the America East championship. Kenny Adeleke had his 23rd double-double of the season, leading Hartford with 21 points and 18 rebounds. Hartford freshman Paris Carter also added 21 points, including five 3-pointers, all late in the game. Boston started the game with a 22-3 run, behind strong 3-point shooting. The Terriers shot 62 percent (8-for-13) from the 3-point arc, while Hartford shot only 17 percent (2-for-12) for 3-pointers in the first half. A Geffen basket with 2.7 seconds left gave the Terriers a season-high 40 first-half points for a 40-26 lead at the break. Boston continued to dominate in the second half. A Geffen 3-pointer with 14:35 left gave the Terriers a commanding 53-36 lead on the way to their fourth victory in the last five games. The Terriers lead the series with Hartford 34-15 and have won the last nine meetings between the two schools. The last time Hartford defeated Boston was on Jan. 29, 2002, when the Hawks won 44-42.
